Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis just as expected”
Reviews.Author: gogoanywhere
Reviews.Content: My fourth trip back to the Edge, this time in the Bali room. The relaxing views of the bay, and the "oasis" feeling in the midst of the Ocean City " roar" is just what I wanted. Stay here, and walk to Fager;s if you get hungry, and you can avoid the crowds and traffic. Featherbed and comfortable sofa, everything you might need. The complaints about ants and such seem totally unfounded - no problems - no ants. Seems like soneone conplained too much! Staff very helpful and attentive. The evening turndown with chocolates and candles, and a breakfast foods each morning add to the ability to tuck in and relax. Will be back again next year - wouldn't chose anywhere else in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room, wonderful view of the bay”
Reviews.Author: ellenanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in #3, the suite called Bliss. The view of the bay is stunning. The decor, the large rooms, the bathroom, were all luxurious. We enjoyed the balcony. Every staff person we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. Upon checking in, we were handed peach sangria and were told that homemade chocolate chip cookies are put out in the great room every afternoon - delicious. Everything was top-notch... except the air conditioning unit. It was more like one we'd encounter at the Holiday Inn Express - buzzing on and off all night, waking us up. And the bed was soft, too soft, we thought. Not a great night's sleep either of the two nights we were there. Still, a good choice for a luxury hotel if the a/c and bed aren't an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Christine W
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice relaxing weekend. As the parents of 2 young kids it was much needed! We stayed at the Lighthouse for our honeymoon 8 years ago and this time we stayed at the Edge.We stayed in the #9 and the view of the bay was amazing. Our room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. We enjoyed our continental breakfast and coffee on the balcony overlooking the bay. We had an excellent dinner at Fager's Island, courtesy of reservations made at the front desk. Seacrets and Macky's are within walking distance. The only suggestion I have is to extend the room service hours. We were surprised that the latest we could order room service was 8:45PM while the restaurant is open much later. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophiecat17
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week and after seeing the two previous reviews about ants and bed bugs, I was very worried. I needn't have been. The room was very clean and no sign of any bugs. The furnishings were gorgeous - the view was beautiful as well. We couldn't have had a better trip. AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Tara1760
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little apprehensive about what I would encounter with the staff based on previous reviews. Everyone I had contact with was very friendly and went out of their way to help. We stayed in the contemporary room and it was amazing! The room is off to the side a bit so it is very private, I recommend it. Someone had mentioned the windows were made so you cannot see in from the outside, this is not true. The room was very clean, and the room was cleaned twice a day. The fridge was stocked with water and soft drinks. The only complaint I have is the parking. The hotel is right next to Fagers Restaurant and at night, a lot of the restaurant guests park in the hotel lot. Luckily we stayed in at night otherwise we would have had to park down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Love the scenery”
Reviews.Author: m2tru
Reviews.Content: The scenery of the bay is absolutly amazing here. We previously stayed at the Lighthouse and loved it. The view from the Riviera is even better! The pictures speak for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukeetraveler-dj
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, scenery, location, great price. From the time you walk to the reception desk, to the time you check out, eerything's top notch. We loved the privacy of the romantic room - set up with 2 robes, 4 poster bed, hot tub overlooking the bay, and a glass-walled shower!

Reviews.Title: “BAIT & SWITCH !!”
Reviews.Author: Zack3239
Reviews.Content: Booked the Penthouse, had the reservation and then they took it away !! Tried to switch me to another room AFTER the reservation was confirmed!! Had stayed there more than 5 times and this is what they do to (formerly) loyal customer!!?? Manager offered to "make it right" by promising to send me a 2 night free coupon. NEVER SENT IT !! BAIT, SWITCH AND LIES ! STAY AWAY !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: travler22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent two long weekends here and have enjoyed both very much. Rooms are comfortable and weel decorated with a good view. Fager Island is a few step away and it has a restaruants/& bar.This is a prefect place for a quick escape.

Reviews.Title: “couples romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Maury D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Edge Hotel for four days. When we checked in we were greeted like VIPs. We stayed in the Orient Express and was very satisfied. Services for this hotel were impeccable. The room was more than we expected. The view was spectacular. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best in OC”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times over the past several years. This was especially nice. Bay-side OC can't be beat. Very relaxing. Have the staff make a sunset reservation at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations are RUDE”
Reviews.Author: chelle695
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to have found this place onine but am thinking twice about staying here now. I have had to call back 3 different times to just to ask questions because each time I feel like I am limited to asking one question and even that is a bother to the person on the other end. Every single time i have called the person answering the phone was extremely rude! I told them I was completely unfamiliar with the hotel and was just trying to get some information and they acted like I was bothering them. When I asked about availability they actually told me they would have to call me back another day to make my reservation???? I have never heard of such a thing! I am very disappointed because I was really looking forward to staying here but due to the terrible customer skills of thier reservationists I do not know if I want even want to now. I will leave another review if I do decide to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Large Suites w/ Great Views”
Reviews.Author: AKPantelis
Reviews.Content: The Edge Suites are a great place to stay in Ocean City if you are looking for spacious rooms w/ great views. The Hotel is located far enough from the crowds of the Boardwalk but close enough to some of Ocean City's highlights. As a part of the Fagers Island complex, there is a foot bridge that goes directly to the restaurant. The hotel is a boutique style hotel that has a very private feel. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows with panoramic views of the Bay and the 60th Street Bridge. Most rooms have an in-suite jacuzzi and the bathrooms are large with walk-in showers. The staff is very friendly, however, guests should know that this is not a 24 hour full-service resort. The front desk and room service are available until 11PM each evening. The only reason that The Edge received 4/5 stars is because some of the room features were a little dated (carpet, window treatments, etc.) and since the suites have floor to ceiling windows, not all of the windows have blinds/curtains. This means that the rooms are VERY bright at about 6AM. Otherwise, if the Edge would make some renovations and updates to room fixtures (especially the blinds) I would give it 5 Stars. Still one of the best places to stay in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, quiet, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: StacyandPat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Memorial weekend. The setting and views make this property special, but there are some quirks. The suites are large and bright. The twenty foot ceiling is terrific and the wall of windows looking out on the water is beautiful. However, all of the windows did not have blinds or treatments which meant the room brightened as the sun rose. We were very surprised that the upper windows did not have blinds and you may want to ask about this when booking. There were many nice touches in the room and at the pool - water and soda stocked in your mini fridge and at the pool in coolers, candles lit at night and the fireplace turned on for when you returned from dinner. The "breakfast" is small (a piece of fruit, some grapes and a slice of coffee cake) and really only keeps you from getting hungry until you can go out and get breakfast. If they cannot access your room on their schedule to leave the breakfast, you will not have the breakfast for the next day. Several members of the staff were very friendly and eager to make sure we had a great visit. A couple were not as eager to be helpful. The location is great. It is a two block walk to the beach and just over a footbridge to dinner at Fagars Island. Overall, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “To die for!”
Reviews.Author: abenton21853
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to the Edge for our 10th anniversary. Everything was perfect! Greeted with mimosa's. We stayed in the Bahli. Beautiful views of the bay. A must for a romantic weekend. Had an awesome dinner just a walk across the bridge at Fagers. Walked in there as VIP. :) They will even drive you there in a golf cart if you'd like. Evening turn down service with a godiva chocolate left on your pillows and all the candles lit. The walk in shower was nice, it was glass so you could see through it. The jacuzzi tub overlooks the bay. The small balcony was perfect for the two of us. We had the best time we've ever had together this weekend. Felt like you were in your own paradise. Definitely didn't feel like you were in OC. Continental breakfast was just that. 2 slices of a nut or fruit loaf, OJ & some fresh fruit, still no complaint! It's a little higher than I would normally pay but this was so worth it and Im glad I did. Can't wait to go back! HIGHLY RECOMMEND FOR ROMANCE!

Reviews.Title: “A great find...relaxing, great views...perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: kktraveler
Reviews.Content: I would never have discovered this gem in Ocean CIty if it had not been for a fellow trip advisor reader who contacted me about another property I have stayed at and we got to talking about unique, out of the ordinary accomodations. Many thanks to her! I had never been to OC before but had heard that the beaches were beautiful. Returning from a roadtrip to visit family in North Carolina, we stopped at a few well known locations along the eastern seaboard. Two nights spent at the Edge along with the spectacular beaches just across the main road have made OC a spot we will return to again in the near future. The Edge is not your typical Ocean City lodging. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the Boardwalk and strip and it is not ocean front. It does however sit on the Bay of Wight and offers spectacular sunset views if you are lucky enough to be here on a clear day. We were booked in the Left Bank Suite, Suite #1. It wasn't my first choice but my husband wanted a balcony and loved the two stories of windows on the 2 walls facing water. The balcony is on the small side with enough room for 2 chairs and a small table and sits just above and to the right of the pool. It is a first floor accomodation. It has a queen bed which offers beautiful water views and a double jacuzzi tucked against the 2 story wall ofwindows. A warning to anyone who may have read in prior posts that one cannot see into the windows. This is untrue. A couple exploring the pool deck walked along a small deck slightly below our windows and seemed to look in ( i would have too)...since the shower area is wide open if you don;t pull the curtains, i asked my husband to go outside and see what he could see....which was everything up to the glass wall of the shower. A warning if you plan to be in the jacuzzi without the shades drawn...which i guess is the point of a jacuzzi in this location offering great water views. In spite of that issue, this is a great room , very spacious and very bright and open. There is a chaise tucked near the balcony slider which offers a great spot to read if the weather outside isn't the best. The sofa is a little stiff but we weren't there to watch TV! At turndown, the girl(s) will light the array of candles scattered through the room and draw the shades but we opted to enjoy the views when we woke and asked that the shades be left open. They deliver breakfast bread, OJ and fruit the night before which personally i would consider a "snack" not a continental breakfast. All were great and appreciated. There is a coffeemaker in the room with Starbucks, teas and hot chocolate as well as a small fridge. The pool area is just above the marsh area and is fairly small. I am not sure if there is another at the Lighthouse. It was overcast and a bit windy and we chose to stay on our deck rather than the pool deck since our view was the same we were so close! Right at the end of the pool area, within 20 ft of our balcony, was an ospray roost which provided alot of natural entertainment as a pair of osprays spent a good portion of each AM and evening. We walked to the beach just across the main road and had it all to ourselves for a few hours as the weather alternated between fog rolling in and the sun struggling to peak through. I am sure in the high season, it is crowded given all the condo units but we enjoyed our quiet pre-season day on this beautiful expanse of the eastern seaboard, We ate dinner at Fagers the first night and returned to eat in the less formal bar area the second night. Sunday night was quiet but Monday there was a DJ and the bar area was very crowded and lively. There are firepits and tables which was lovely and appreciated during our stay which was a little cool and overcast! I am sure after driving around contemplating other dining spots that this is one of the best Ocean CIty has to offer. This Hotel is a great find though quite different from the other accomodations at Ocean City

Reviews.Title: “Perfect O.C. hideaway”
Reviews.Author: BMore_1989
Reviews.Content: If you've ever been to the Ocean, you must stop by and see the hidden treasure that is the Edge Hotel and Suites. These are private suites that are hidden away from the hustle and bustle of the Ocean City vacationers. My husband and I have stayed here 3 times and our suite was just perfect! They're open year round and the rates are exceptional. You are still within a short distance of the Boardwalk and all other O.C./Rehoboth hotspots. Wonderful trip and beautiful stay. Thanks to Fager's Island!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful... Romantic... Unique.”
Reviews.Author: OCsandy
Reviews.Content: As I write this review my first thought is how could there possibly be 25 better hotels than this one in Ocean City. (Today it is listed as #26.) As a local, I certainly never have a need for hotels except on a special occasion, which this was. We stayed at The Edge for our anniversary night, enjoying dinner at Fager's Island (just across a rustic wooden bridge) next door. We had heard about the different 'themed' rooms, and decided on the Oriental. It was an excellent choice! (We later asked for, and was taken on a tour, to see the decor of the other rooms. Every one of them was beautiful.) The hotel was pristinely clean, bright, with a wonderful view of the bay (and wildfowl) through huge windows. But perhaps the best part of all was the quietness. ("Quiet" in Ocean City? Incredible!) I need not go into more detail. Suffice to say that you will NOT be disappointed with a stay at this hotel. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT bring the kids. First off, they will be disappointed for the lack of things to do (and the location - away from everything), and secondly, they may disturb the ambience for the rest of the guests. Looking for a romantic night? Stay here. Period. I wanted to stay for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip”
Reviews.Author: Isabella038
Reviews.Content: Again this year my husband and I are heading for Ocean City MD for our anniversary. Our favorite place to stay is The Lighthouse and the Edge. In all the many times we have been there we have found no faults. Mary at the front desk is always friendly and helpful. We had stayed at other places in Ocean City and were never really happy till we found The Lighthouse and Edge.. We have recommended this to family and friends who loved it also.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TRenee55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Edge as a weekend getaway and it was exactly that! My boyfriend and I loved everything about this place. When we reserved the room, we were kind of reluctant to stay in the Bali room because it was noted as the "smaller, more intimate" room at the hotel. We were really surprised to find out how big it actually was (looks like approx. 500 - 600sq.ft). Much bigger and better than the average hotel room. (Although we peeked into some of the other rooms while they were being cleaned and they were HUGE!) Everything in the room was well appointed and intimate, from the furniture to the bathroom. There is a small patio that overlooks the Bay. There is a slight view of the pool also. The jacuzzi also had a beautiful view of the Bay. There is a nice flat screen over the fireplace, a wet bar, refrigerator, teas and coffee maker. There is complimentary soda and water, as well as glasses (even wine glasses). The staff were very nice. Even though they closed at 11pm, we didn't need them for anything that late anyway. Suzy at the front desk was very nice and she made our dinner reservations for us each night. Fagers Island restaurant and bar was excellent. There was an appropriate scene for whatever you like, all under one roof. There was a "sports" bar, "tiki" bar, sand, fine dining, outdoor dining, dance floor, live band, DJ - pretty impressive. All of this right over the beautiful wooden footbridge. Have fun and I hope this long review helps! P.S. When making your reservations make sure you call and check the availability of the rooms that you like (based on the pics from the web) because the online reservation system doesn't allow you to choose your room.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: realreview_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. I am pretty amazed about the reviews of the other people. This place is definitely not worth $200+. Breakfast is awe full. You get only two muffins, orange juice and some fruits. Building is too old and the service is real terrible. The receptionist leaves at 11.00 PM. If you want some service after 11, you are on your own. You will not find a single person to attend to your call. We stayed there during early may and it was still a bit cold. To my surprise they didn't have the heating system enabled ( What a waste of 200$ ). We were provided with a heater. Its really amazing how much they charge for the kind of facilities they have. One suggestion : Please spend your money wisely!!! Choose a better option!!! If you still decide to stay there, at least make sure you ask them to change the covers. They change it every other day unless you request them to change daily.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis In The Middle Of Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Beach
Reviews.Content: I was given a gift certicate to stay two nights at the Edge in Ocean City. I have always loved Ocean City for it's high energy lifestyle. Always somwthing to do all the time. Like my life, I am always busy. Than I drove into Ocean City one cold day in December 2009 and I was in for a complete surprise. Owned by Fagers Island, the Edge is more like an Inn than a hotel. It is nestled in between Fager's Island and The Light House Inn on the bay in central OC. You cross a small bridge to get to either the Lighthouse or the Edge and if you want to go to Fager's Island, it is only accessable by a foot bridge. So even in OC, you feel like you are on a remote island. The room we stayed in was not like any other hotel I ever stayed in at OC. The shower and bathroom are about the size of a small bedroom. The bedroom/living room consited of a very comfortable bed, a not so comfortable sofa, an electric fireplace, a jacuzzi tub right next to the floor to ceiling(2 story) windows overlooking the bay. and a small little private pool within steps of the back door of your room. They had a moist breakfast cake and fresh fruit for us in our room waiting for us along with fresh squeezed OJ and assorted sodas and water all at no additional cost. What a relaxing two days that will stay with our family forever. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Hesitant to write”
Reviews.Author: Alburtistraveler
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to write a review about the Edge because I don't want anymore people to find out about this place. I have made my reservations for next year, so I guess I am safe for another year. This was our first stay- we were in the Hang Five penthouse- and it was absolutely fabulous. We were in town for our wedding at Seacrets, and this is truly a honeymooners paradise. The room was so spacious and beautifully decorated, and the location was so quiet and tranquil. We had a panoramic view of the Isle of Wight Bay. I loved coming in at night to find the fireplace on and all the candles lit. My husband and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express room is a must visit”
Reviews.Author: shelshoc9
Reviews.Content: I never wrote a review about a place until now... this place was awesome! The hotel is broken into two different buildings: the Lighthouse Club and The Edge each only has about a dozen rooms. I chose to stay at the Edge because they had rooms that were decorated with different themes. The room I stayed in was the Orient Express - my first impression was WOW! The room has ceiling to floor windows that overlook the bay , there was a gas fireplace, balcony seating area, king sized platform bed (super comfy), beautiful bathroom, and a heart shaped jacuzzi that sat in the window (but still very private). This place was made for romance! Additional highlights - the sunset is spectacular from the room, they have homemade cookies and tea/coffee served around 6pm in the main building, ordered room service from the restaurant (reasonable and tasty), they light candles all around the room for you each night and in the morning they bring you juice, fruit and muffins. Had a wonderful time and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Romance”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser0814
Reviews.Content: A true romantic getaway. We live very close to Ocean City and love to go there for get-away weekends. But there are very few "upscale" places to stay. The new Hilton is an Excellent place and we very happy that they have finally come to town. BUT for a true ROMANTIC GET AWAY "The Edge" is a one in a million location. If there are other hotels like The Edge, I don't know them. We love the large 'water room' style bathroom/shower room. It is the bathroom of our dreams and the bed is so soft and comfortable, fabulous linens. We love to sit and watch the sunset on the beautiful Isle of Wight Bay and wetlands. We go back every year for either our anniversay weekend or Valentines weekend - if my husband's work permits. Try the Crepe and Omlet place for a great breakfast or brunch!

Reviews.Title: “The Lighthouse”
Reviews.Author: RCountrytravel
Reviews.Content: The property is attractive and located on the water, bay side of Ocean City--has much potential with better management. Our stay was far less than a four star experience; room was hot when we checked in, shower had substantial black mold, a live houseplant was covered with white mold, a shower handle fell off the door, long distance telephone service was blocked and toilet was plugged; attendant did not know how to resolve either issue and we finally received the key to another room in the event other issues arose after the attendant left at 11 PM--as it turned out we did not need the other room. For the $315 fee, The Edge can do much better! Tom Dienst

Reviews.Title: “So Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: RWNW
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband here for his special birthday. We stayed in Room 1, "The Left Bank" which has a 20' ceiling and windows that dominate the wall facing the bay. The room had all the amenities and was so relaxing. A continental breakfast is delivered every evening for the following morning, which we ate on the balcony overlooking the bay, listening to the sound of the seagulls flying over the water and watching the gentle ripples of the currents. We loved the swimming pool -- so different from the usual run of the mill hotel pools. With this pool, you walk into it like you would at the beach or lake; the steps are further in. It's very cosy with lounge chairs arranged around the pool. The people we met at the pool were very friendly, and, while the pool is not large, it was never crowded. While there were some housekeeping issues with our room, they were minor and remedied immediately. The staff were very friendly and responsive. We ate several times at the property's restaurant, The Restaurant at Fager's Island, and were never disappointed. I can highly recommend the mojito's -- (especially the mango mojito) -- the best ever! The lobster tails were also especially sweet and deliciious. The strawberry shortcake is to die for! We hope to make this an end-of-summer tradition and come back each year and stay in the same room. There are only 12 rooms in The Edge and each one is decorated in a different style. We did see some other rooms, but we decided we liked The Left Bank best and hope to stay in this room again. If you want to escape someplace to totally relax and reconnect, then you want to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tequila-sunrise00
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted at the door and offered sangria while we checked in. We, and our luggage, were then loaded onto a golf cart by a gentleman who drove us over a small bridge to our room. We stayed in suite #9, each room is different. He gave the run down of the room. We asked him how far the beach was and he offered to drive us to the bus stop when we were ready. when we called he was at our room right away, it then started to rain lightly and we decided to drive. There is maid service twice a day. The room was immaculate. I once accidently left some money laying around along with my camera and I am pleased to say it was right where I left it when I returned. The room was kept stocked with free soda, godiava coffee, hot cocoa and tea. There were lovely glass mugs for drinking. The only charge for the refreshments was for the Fuji water which we decided not to drink. The "continental" breakfast is two small plates of breakfast bread, fresh grapes and orange juice. Not much, but still nice. It was enough to tide us over until we got out in the morning. The bed was incredibly comfortable. At night, there was the turndown service. Candles lit around the room, chocolates on the pillows and the electric fireplace lit. The heartshaped jacuzzi is right by the window. No worries, there is nothing but gorgeous water (not the beach) so no one can see in. There were comfy robes and thick , plush towels, extra large ones at the jacuzzi. This is a room for couples, the standing shower is open with no curtain. (No room for modesty) I was a little sensitive to the soap and had a very unpleasant reaction. Not a big deal, I ran out to CVS and bought what I normally use. The crab cakes at the restaurant were so good, when we checked out we got some for the road. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: jensysk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edge in August 2006 in the South Beach Penthouse Suite. We previously stayed at the Lighthouse so we were familiar with Fager's Island. I found the Edge to be much nicer than the Lighthouse, although it is quite expensive at $400 a night (make sure to ask for the AAA discount, that saved us 10% a night). The suite was nicely decorated and very comfortable. The hot tub overlooking the bay was very relaxing and the king size bed was comfortable with a nice pillow top mattress pad. The views are incredible and it was a real pleasure to sit out on the balcony during the evening sunsets. The room has an "electric" fireplace, which is just a fake fireplace that lights up -- it's cheesy and not at all like a real fireplace. As other reviews have noted, the continental breakfast is a bit skimpy, if the pound cake were just double the size, then it would be fine. The nightclub at Fager's Island goes until about 2 a.m. and we could hear the music in our room so we had to put the air conditioning fan on to drown out the sound -- next time we'll bring a white noise machine. The only other downside is that the housekeeping staff is very, very slow -- they were all quite friendly and did a great job, but were slow; they took about an hour to clean our room each morning and the evening turndown service took about 15 minutes; so several times we ended up waiting out on the balcony for them to finish, it was definitely the slowest housekeeping crew I've encountered of all the hotels I've stayed at. I wish they'd add online booking as an option on their website. Other than that, it's a great place for a weekend getaway and we'll likely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: concdid
Reviews.Content: I recently joined this site to complain about another hotel. While I was here, I figured I'd write about my experiences at both The Edge and The Lighthouse. Although pricey, it's a very quiet getaway for couples. I honestly base my experiences at other hotels to that of the Edge and Hershey Hotel. I've never had a problem. Everyone is very helpful, it is always clean and if you are looking to have a quiet time away, this is it. The view of the bay is wonderful, the staff helpful and you never feel like you are a bother. We look forward to going back time after time, it's always consistant. The food at Fagers Island is always great as well, you don't have to go far to have a nice time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: usafan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Edge for four nights during our two week vacation to the Chesapeake area. We were both wowed by the Edge from the start - being presented by a cocktail on arrival and opening the door to our incredible room (Riviera). We have stayed in some lovely hotels but our room at The Edge ranks amongst our top three for its sheer size (with double height ceilings), the huge four-poster bed, heart-shaped jacuzzi in the corner and balcony hanging directly over the bay. The decor is contemporary and cosy and includes an open wet-room/shower and electric, real-flame fireplace. Just to add to the romantic atmosphere, the turn-down service means that you return to your room to find the place lit with candles and Godiva chocolates left on your pillow. The staff (Andrea in particular) were invaluable in pointing out a number of restaurants in Ocean City, based on the type of food/environment we were looking for and booked taxis for us where necessary. If I was to make any criticism, it would only be that the breakfast was the same every morning and after four nights, a little variation would have been nice. Otherwise, The Edge was one of the highlights to our holiday and made our trip to Ocean City unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Splurge”
Reviews.Author: leisurefun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ran away to the beach for Mother's Day weekend. The Edge reviews sounded like the romantic destination we wanted. We were not disappointed. The room, Island Monkey, is light, airy and huge with cathedral ceilings. Great little porch overlooking the bay for sunsets. Cool tile bathroom with huge stone shower, but a curtain or door would make it warmer. The hot tub and electric fireplace are nice, romantic touches. Loved the king bed with luxiurious linens and fluffy pillows.Lots of nice little touches too - continental breakfast delivered to the room (yummy pound cake), coffee, tea, hot chocolate, chocolates, robes, etc. Its expensive but great for a special occasion. AAA discount saved us $60...

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with The Edge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the hotel is absolutely romantic in every aspect. We felt like our room was floating on the bay (the windows were about 3 ft from the bay), the luxurious accomodations were top quality (esp. the heart-shaped double jacuzzi and the gas fireplace). We stayed in the riviera suite. The evening turndown service was a treat. Any time we had a problem, the staff took care of it right away. We hope to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “So romantic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have travelled the world and with the exception of a small hotel in Bali this is my favorite place to stay besides home. Every room is different, and every room is equally beautiful. Although in the summer you are right in the middle of busy Ocean City (walking distance to fine restaurants and the beach) when you are in your room all the world feels serene. This hotel is so romantic! It would be perfect for a honeymoon (or a second or third ;). For dessert I had a perfect chocolate martini at Fager's Restaurant (next door) when we got back to the room the candles were already lit and the lights were turned low (swoon).

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a perfect weekend getaway at The Edge Hotel in Ocean City. The Edge is located on Fager's Island at 56th Street which is right near the Assawoman Bay Bridge. We felt it was a perfect location for those who don't want to deal with the huge high rise hotels and the hustle and bustle of the crowds on the boardwalk. From the outside, The Edge looks like a modern condo building. There are only 12 suites, and it's location is very quiet and unassuming. We stayed on the 3rd floor in the South Beach Penthouse suite. The room was beautifully furnished and offered panoramic views of the bay from an entire wall of west-facing windows. The bathroom was very modern, with glass-block walls and an open granite and glass-block shower. There is also a huge whirlpool situated in front of the windows (with blinds of course!) were you can soak away and enjoy the sunset. The hotel offers many wonderful touches: Tommy Bahama furnishings, twice daily housekeeping, luxury Frette linens, down comforters and pillows, Cali bath products, and plush towels and bath robes. Attention to detail was evident during nightly turndown service where the staff lit the many candles throughout the room, and left Godiva chocolates on the pillows. Room service also stocked the refrigerator each evening with a continental breakfast for enjoyment in the morning. We were thrilled that The Edge met our high expectations, and can't wait to return!
